gameFiles

Class ButtonObstacle

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameFiles.ButtonObstacle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Obstacle

    public class ButtonObstacle
extends java.lang.Object
implements Obstacle
    Button obstacles for the game, a cirlce that prevents the ball from passing through it and grants points when hit.
    Version:
    v4.0 June 12th, 2014
    Author:
    Jason P'ng

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ButtonObstacle()
      This is the default constructor of this object, and predifine the coordinates, radius, bounce value and colour.
      ButtonObstacle(float x, float y, float radius, float bounce, java.awt.Color colour)
      This is constructor is used to create buttonobstacles in the specified region, with a specified colour and
      specified bounce value.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ButtonObstacle

        public ButtonObstacle()
        This is the default constructor of this object, and predifine the coordinates, radius, bounce value and colour.

      • ButtonObstacle

        public ButtonObstacle(float x,
                      float y,
                      float radius,
                      float bounce,
                      java.awt.Color colour)
        This is constructor is used to create buttonobstacles in the specified region, with a specified colour and
        specified bounce value.
        Parameters:
        float - x this variable specifies the x coordinate of the center of the ball.
        float - y this variable specifies the y coordinate of the center of the ball.
        float - radius this variable specifies the radius of the obstacle.
        float - bounce this variable specifies the change in energy when a collision occurs.
        Color - colour this variable specifies the colour of the onject.

      • updatePos

        public void updatePos(float x,
                      float y)
        This method is used to update the current position of the obstacle in case it needs to be moved.
        Parameters:
        float - x this variable specifies the x coordinate of the center of the ball.
        float - y this variable specifies the y coordinate of the center of the ball.
